We look to promote businesses and business leaders who aspire to inspire more black women and men to make a positive difference to the economy and the world at large.

By creating a progressive and positive arena in which black businesses can come together, The UK Black Business Show will assist both attendees and exhibitors to make meaningful connections and will Steven Bartlett

Entrepreneur, speaker, investor, bestselling author and the host of UK’s No.1 podcast ‘The Diary of a CEO’
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]Steven Bartlett is an Entrepreneur, speaker, investor, author and the host of UK’s No.1 podcast ‘The Diary of a CEO’ – an unfiltered journey into the remarkable stories and untold dimensions of the world’s most influential people, experts and thinkers.

Steven is an accomplished investor in the health and wellness space with notable investments including Huel – UK’s fastest growing e-commerce company internationally, and Zoe – the personalised nutrition programme created by the world’s top scientists. Previous investments include The Healing Company, atai Life Sciences, Alto Neuroscience and AbCellera. Steven’s other investments focus on blockchain technologies, biotech, space, Web 3 and social media.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”2″ Afua Hirsch

Bestselling Writer & Filmmaker
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]Afua Hirsch is a bestselling writer and filmmaker, the author of four books including the award-winning Brit(ish): On Race, Identity and Belonging (2018) and Decolonising My Body, A Radical Exploration of Rituals and Beauty (2023). She co-presented Samuel L. Jackson’s major TV series Enslaved in 2020, and Africa Rising, an ongoing BBC series exploring the art and culture of African countries. A journalist for more than twenty years, she is a former Guardian correspondent, Associate Editor at Vogue, and professor of journalism at the University of Southern California.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”2″ divider_color=”accent-color” animate=”yes” custom_height=”20″][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner Dwain Reid

Entrepreneur and Business Growth Consultant
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]Dwain Reid, an inspiring Business Growth Coach has a remarkable journey from growing his childcare business to becoming the largest provider in its borough. Now, he’s on a mission to empower underrepresented founders, specialising in lead generation, business cadence and raising investment. With a track record of supporting over 10,000 founders, Dwain’s expertise has helped launch successful ventures, facilitated £1m+ of investments, including working with Forbes Family Group and their Cap Table Pitch Competition.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”2″ divider_color=”accent-color” animate=”yes” Ken & Mary Okoroafor

Sunday Times Bestselling authors of Financial Joy, and award-winning founder and CEO of The Humble Penny and Financial Joy Academy
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]Ken and Mary Okoroafor are instant Sunday Times Bestselling authors of, Financial Joy, a 10-week plan to help you banish debt, grow your money and unlock financial freedom. Nissi Ogulu

Creative, engineer and entrepreneur
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]Nissi Ogulu popularly known as Nissi is a London-based dynamic creative, engineer and entrepreneur. Born in 1994 to Bose Ogulu a renowned media/entertainment executive & Samuel Ogulu. She is grand-daughter to Benson Idonije; the award-winning music critic, author, veteran broadcaster and first manager to the Afrobeat Pioneer & African Legend Fela Anikulapo Kuti. She is also the youngest sister to the Grammy Award Winning Music Superstar, Burna Boy.
The multi-talented innovator is an entrepreneur with a staunch cultural advocacy for strategic innovation, product manufacturing and its impact on the technology industry especially in Africa. Nissi graduated from the University of Warwick in the UK, with a Bachelor’s (honours) degree in Mechanical Engineering (BEng), and a Distinction Postgraduate Accreditations in Sustainable Design and Innovation Technology from reputable Universities, Loughborough & Warwick.
Founder, Nissi’s heart for innovation and product manufacturing led her to found Kemet Automotive with Rui Mendes Da Silva. Nissi envisions Kemet to transform the African automotive market leading to global feats. She remains steadfast in her commitment to leading innovation in a sustainable way in the technology industry.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”2″ Siobhan Rogan

Professional Hiring Team Lead, bp
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]I have worked in Talent focussed roles for over 15 years, from the recruitment and development of students and graduates through to my current role as a Professional Hiring Team Lead at bp. In addition to the over-arching aim to attract and recruit top talent into the organisation, I am passionate about the experiences that we provide to candidates and those who are hiring along the way – particularly when it comes to consistency and fairness in process. Diversity, Equity & Inclusion is very much at the heart of this endeavour, and I have been proud to develop and lead on numerous programmes and initiatives to support this through my career.

Outside of work I am a busy mum of 2 young boys and whether with them (or without!) love to swim, travel and try new foods.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”2″ Kanayo Oweazim

Business Growth and Entrepreneurship Pillar Lead for Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion, J.P. Morgan
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]As the Business Growth and Entrepreneurship Lead, Kanayo is responsible for creating programs that deliver business support services, resources, tools, and education to the underserved entrepreneurial community. He collaborates with senior leaders and functional partners across industries and interfaces directly with non-profit organizations and other partners as a thought leader. Beth Dinnall

Senior Creative Strategist, BBC Sport
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Beth Dinnall is a seasoned Senior Planner and Creative Strategist at BBC Sport, with an impressive portfolio spanning some of the world’s most iconic sporting events, including the Olympics, The Euros, Wimbledon, and The Hundred. With over six years of dedicated service at the BBC, Beth has significantly contributed to various platforms such as BBC Three, Radio 1, 1Xtra, and the Asian Network.

A former member of the Director General’s Next Generation Committee, Beth has also been involved in presenting to EXCO and consulting on projects, bringing fresh perspectives and innovative ideas to the forefront of BBC’s executive decisions. Her commitment to mentorship is evident through her active participation in the 10,000 Black Interns scheme at the BBC, where she helps guide and support the next generation of media professionals.

As a passionate diversity champion, Beth has been instrumental in driving pan-BBC initiatives like Nuance Portrayal and emphasising the critical importance of both on and off-screen representation. Her work ensures that diverse voices and stories are celebrated and accurately represented across all BBC platforms.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”2″ Melvin Odoom

Radio & Television Presenter
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Melvin Odoom is a Radio and Television presenter. You can hear him on BBC Radio1’s Live Lounge from 10:15 Monday – Thursday and when not on radio, Melvin is a club DJ across the UK and Spain.

As a TV presenter Melvin has presented popular TV series including ‘Celebrity Cooking School’ for E4 and All4, ‘Big Breakfast’ and ‘Lego Masters’ on Channel4 and ITV2’s ‘The Xtra Factor’ alongside Rochelle Humes. Melvin has appeared on various shows for MTV, ITV and BBC and hosted the BRIT Awards red carpet for three years for ITV2. In 2016 we saw Melvin hit the dance floor in series fourteen of BBC’s ‘Strictly Come Dancing’. He went on to join the cast for the 2016 Christmas special where he took the crown and won the competition![/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”2″ Rickie Haywood-Williams

Radio & Television Presenter
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Rickie Haywood-Williams is a radio presenter, television broadcaster and DJ. He is currently on air alongside co-hosts Melvin and Charlie from 10:30am-12:45pm, Monday to Thursday on BBC Radio 1. The daytime show is home of the Live Lounge and is known for combining light-hearted entertainment and fun artist interviews with specialist music to their nationwide audience.

Previously to Radio 1, he hosted the Kiss FM Breakfast Show and helped the station achieve record figures and win countless awards, including a Sony Gold for Best Breakfast Sow at the Radio Academy Awards. Dean Forbes

CEO, Forterro
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Dean Forbes has been named the UK’s second most influential Black person in the Powerlist 2024. The annual award recognises people of African, African American and African Caribbean heritage in the UK. The list was topped by British Vogue’s outgoing editor-in-chief, Edward Enninful. On Forbes’ influence, the judges said: ‘Dean has had a stellar year following his landmark €1bn transaction between Forterro and Partners Group in 2022, which is still the largest European deal led by a CEO of African Caribbean heritage.

Forterro is now the UK’s sixth largest privately held software company. The citation continues: ‘As CEO, Dean has continued to scale Forterro by increasing profits by 30 per cent through top and bottom-line growth, in addition to accelerating growth through active mergers and acquisitions. Whilst running Forterro, Dean has also increased his work as the sole African Caribbean partner at Corten Capital – the €1.2bn+ private equity fund – where he is responsible for growth and value creation.’

Dean Forbes is also recognised for his work on the board of Cornerstone, and his foundation, the Forbes Family Group. In honour of Dean Forbes being recognised, revisit his interview with Spear’s when he spoke of how his rise from telesales operative to €1 billion Forterro chief is grounded in pride, ego and self-analysis[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”2″ divider_color=”accent-color” animate=”yes” custom_height=”20″][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner Oliemata O’Donoghue

Head of Secured Lending UK, HSBC UK
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Oli O’Donoghue is the Head of Secured Lending UK, responsible for leading and directing the customer experiences, journeys and products for residential and specialised lending across the direct and intermediary channels for HSBC and First Direct.

With more than 25 years’ experience in financial services, Oli has spent a large portion of her career at Barclays across a variety of roles. Oli moved to HSBC in 2017, leading the Branch Network teams across the UK as Managing Director.

Oli was awarded an MBE in 2023 for her services to diversity in Financial Services. She is passionate about Diversity, Equity and Inclusion in the workplace and society. Oli strongly believes that you must be the change you want to see, and we all have a part to play in driving inclusion; she values fairness and equality and being a big sponsor for Employee Resource Groups allows her to drive what she is so passionate about.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”2″ divider_color=”accent-color” animate=”yes” Lamar Tyler

Co-Founder, Traffic Sales and Profit
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Lamar Tyler is the CEO and co-founder of Traffic Sales & Profit (TSP) – one of the fastest-growing private companies in America recognized four consecutive years by Inc. magazine on its annual Inc. 5000 list. TSP is America’s premier learning community of over 47K purpose-driven African American businesses and entrepreneurs, Lamar created his platform alongside his wife, Ronnie Tyler, to not only help guide Black businesses and families to discover their true purpose and legacy, but to also change the economic landscape of the Black community by closing the wealth gap through entrepreneurship.

Lamar is one of the leading and most influential voices in business and digital marketing and has received countless recognition for his work, including being listed as one of Ebony Magazine’s Power 100 as well as the recipient of the ClickFunnels Two Comma Club X Award and the ClickFunnels Bootstrapped Entrepreneur of the Year Award for Coaching & Consulting (2023). His most recent win is Black Enterprise Magazine’s 2023 Disruptor of the Year Award.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”2″ divider_color=”accent-color” animate=”yes” Richie Brave

Presenter, Broadcaster, Writer & Host, BBC 1Xtra
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Richie Brave is a Presenter, Broadcaster & Writer hailing from South London. He is known for his hard-hitting interviews and honest social criticism, which challenges people to think and reflect on themselves. Aside from his media experience, he has amassed over a decade’s worth of work in the community and uses this to shape and create engaging dialogue and interviews. Richie is host of BBC 1Xtra’s “1Xtra Talks” exploring the lived experiences of Black people across the UK.

Richie has interviewed the likes of Whoopi Goldberg, Ryan Coogler, Angela Bassett, HER, Master P, Mr Eazi, Wale and many others. Through 2018/19 he regularly co-hosted the Sunday Morning show with Penny Smith on Talk Radio, exploring the tabloids, politics and debating current affairs. This versatility speaks to his ability to engage anyone.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”2″ divider_color=”accent-color” animate=”yes” Ebun Omilaju

Product Manager, Kobalt Music
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Ebun is a Product Manager in the music industry, dedicated to building user-focused products that emphasise efficiency, transparency, and innovation. She has a rich tapestry of experience across multiple sectors, shaped by her tenure at organisations including Accenture, Merck, and BNY Mellon, where she honed her cross-industry expertise.

From a young age, Ebun demonstrated an entrepreneurial spirit, launching a successful baking business at 14. This early venture laid the groundwork for her passion in entrepreneurship and innovation.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”2″ divider_color=”accent-color” Dr. Tru Powell

Co-Founder & CEO, Black Business Magazine
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Dr. Tru Powell is a multi-award winning personal brand expert and creative entrepreneur. Tru has over 15 years in enterprise, the arts, and live events, and is very passionate about supporting the next generation of entrepreneurs to get visible and build their personal brands. As well as the Founder and Director of Tru Powell Consultancy & Events Ltd, Tru is the founder of the Inspire Awards. Previously, he served as the CEO of the Multicultural Business & Community Champion Awards (MBCC’s). He is also the CEO of the Black Business Magazine, a premier online and print publication dedicated to uplifting and empowering the Black community, and Director of Aston Performing Arts Academy.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”2″ divider_color=”accent-color” animate=”yes” custom_height=”20″][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner Joy Gharoro-Akpojotor

Founder & Producer, Joi Productions
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Joy Gharoro-Akpojotor runs Joi Productions. In 2019, she produced the hit Blue Story, which became the top grossing film of its genre. In 2020, she was named a Screen International Star of Tomorrow and a BAFTA Breakthrough, as well as Joi Productions receiving a BFI Vision Award. At the end of 2021, she produced Aml Ameen’s debut, Boxing Day, the first all-black Christmas film out of the UK.

More recently Joy has produced Champion for BBC and Netflix. In 2022 Ringside Studio acquired a stake in Joi Productions.

Nadine Marsh-Edwards

Co-Founder, Greenacre Films
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Nadine Marsh-Edwards is a BAFTA and RTS award winning film and television producer and co – founder along side Amanda Jenks of Greenacre Films, a female led independent production company, who with Story Compound recently launched The Residency, an incubator for writers of Action and Thriller films supported by the BFI. They are also recipients of the BBC Small Indie Fund as well the BFI Global Screen Fund.

She recently Exec Produced Riches, a six-part drama series for ITV/AMAZON PRIME written by Abby Ajayi. Unsaid Stories for ITV and The Ruins of Empire for the BBC. She also produced the Emmy nominated, BAFTA and RTS winning drama series Joe All Alone for the BBC.

Chris Emechete

Founder & CEO, 3TOP Aviation Services (3TOP)
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Chris Emechete is the Founder & CEO of 3TOP Aviation Services (3TOP), a UK company specialising in acquiring, trading and leasing commercial aircraft, engines, and associated inventory; with over £40M in annual revenue. Starting the business from scratch, Chris saw an opportunity in the aircraft parts supply chain and implemented a business model around asset acquisitions, teardowns, repairs and disposals.

Cora McLaren

Managing Director & Head of International Subsidiary Banking, HSBC UK
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Cora McLaren joined HSBC in September 2012 and took up her current role as Managing Director, Head of International Subsidiary Banking in April 2022. Cora is a member of the UK Commercial Banking Executive Committee. In her role, Cora is responsible for leading a team of international banking professionals and supporting HSBC clients expand their businesses internationally, leveraging HSBC’s global network. Cora has 25 years of experience in the financial industry. In her role, she frequently engages with corporates who are entering or expanding in the UK and UK businesses expanding overseas to provide support and connections to enable their success.

Folake Shasanya

Managing Director, Innovation Economy, J.P. Morgan
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Folake Shasanya, is a Managing Director at J.P. Morgan heading up venture capital relationship coverage for the Innovation Economy EMEA Team.

Folake has over 20 years’ experience in tech and finance. She joined from Silicon Valley Bank where she was an MD in Venture Capital Relationship team and Head of New and Strategic Channels. She was a member of the Senior leadership team and established the fintech warehouse financing business. Prior to SVB, Folake led Structured Finance solutions at Credit Suisse, NatWest Markets and AFME.

Khalia Ismain

Black Entrepreneurs Programme Manager, Lloyds Banking Group
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Khalia Ismain is Lloyds Bank’s first Black Entrepreneurs Programme Manager, running the bank’s initiatives to support the sustained progression of Black-owned businesses. In 2023, the programme engaged 5,500 entrepreneurs with 23,000 hours of support, and dispersed £50,000 in grant funding to Black-founded start-ups. She expanded the bank’s partnerships to ensure the programme caters to the varying needs of Black business owners across regions, sectors and life-stages, with the most notable partnership being with Channel 4 to provide 5 businesses with £100k TV advertising.

Taylor Mirkarimi

DEI Program Manager | EMEA Talent Acquisition, Amazon
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Taylor is a highly recognised Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) professional and proud Black woman. Born in the UK, raised in Barbados and also having travelled to over 20 countries thus far, her multinational experience has given her a unique, globally-minded perspective. In her current role as DEI Program Manager for EMEA Talent Acquisition at Amazon, Taylor is responsible for embedding DEI strategy and programs at the core of the company’s recruitment workflows. Concurrently, she serves as Vice President of the Black Employee Network UK Operations chapter, supporting all sites across the UK & Ireland in ensuring members feel seen, heard and valued. With an unconventional career journey spanning various industries and business functions, Taylor has a consistent track record of showcasing her authentic self and championing equity in the workplace.
